Sassquatch Mobile

Visually documenting differences from desktop Sassquatch and new mobile patterns.

Anything marked is available in Meetup chapstick, but coming soon to Sassquatch.

  Pardon our dust!

Layout

doc-box

For the most part .doc-box is inherited from desktop Sassquatch.
It's rounded and bordered and has a white background.
In order for the boxy-ness to be seen in a one-column layout, it also has margins in mobile Sassquatch.

This is a basic doc-box. It has no padding so right now it looks pretty cramped. It usually wraps some kind of content, like .doc-content or .touchList

doc-content

.doc-content is basically just padded content. It can sit directly on the background, like this one is. Believe it or not, this is wrapped in .doc-content.

OR it can be nested within a doc-box for header, footer, and sections:

Slightly complex doc-box

It has .doc-content children to wrap the heading and section.

There are tags for these elements on mobile: m:box, m:section, m:head, m:foot.

TODO: full-width, unrounded, white doc-box or doc-content extension.

fix-flex

This layout pattern is used often in lists when we need to display different content in columns. .ffbox wraps elements that are either .ffbox-flex or .ffbox-fix.

It causes some elements in the row

to flex their width to fill the container, while other elements stay

FIXED

Touch Lists

Right now, the touchList class is applying some overrides to the way font-size, margin and padding are defined in sectionLists and dividedLists

Basic TouchList

This is an example of the most basic touchlist.

  • Item 1

  • Item 2

  • Item 3

Attendee Item TouchList

Initially designed for the Attendee/RSVP list on event details, we can use this pattern whenever we need to display member data in a list.

  • Spock (+5 )

    Science Officer
    Good to see you

  • Dr. Leonard McCoy

    Chief Medical Officer
    Good to see you

  • Nyota Uhura

    Communications Officer
    Good to see you

  • James T. Kirk

    Captain
    Good to see you 
<!-- HTML -->
<li class="touchList-item touchList-item--attendee">
    <div class="ffbox">
        <div class="ffbox-flex">
            <a href="${member_url}" class="ffbox ffbox--touchList-item ffbox--fixed">
                <div class="ffbox-fix avatar-m pintop touchList-attendee-photo">
                    <img src="assets/img/spock.jpg" />
                </div>
                <div class="ffbox-flex touchList-attendee-info">
                    <h4 class="touchList-label touchList-attendee-name">
                        Spock
                        <span class="touchList-guestcount">(+5 )</span>
                    </h4>
                    <h6 class="touchList-caption touchList-attendee-role">Science Officer</h6>
                </div>
            </a>
        </div>
        <div class="ffbox-fix touchList-attendee-actions">
            <a class="button small niceToSeeYou primary" href="#">
                <span>Good to see you</span>
            </a>
        </div>
    </div>
</li>

    </ul>
</div>

Segmented Touch List

  • Android Phones
    • Motorola Droid X (2.3)
    • Samsung Galaxy S (4.0)
    • Samsung Galaxy S3 Mini (4.1)
    • Galaxy Nexus 4 (4.3)
  • Windows Phones
    • LG Quantum (7.5)
    • Nokia Lumia 620 (8)
  • iOS Devices
    • iPhone 3G (4.1.3)
    • iPhone 3GS (6.1.3)
    • iPhone 4 (6.1.4)
    • iPhone 4S (6.1.3)
    • iPhone 5 (6.1.4)
    • iPod Touch 5 (7.0)
